identified-content.person: Cunningham, Margaret Barclay (Margaret Barclay Whitten) Whitten, Dr. Joseph Anthony

block.p: Margaret Barclay Cunningham and Dr. Joseph Anthony Whitten were married last evening at the Episcopal Church of St. Michael and St. George in St. Louis. The Rev. Andrew Archie, rector of the church, performed the ceremony in which the Rev. Margaret R. Rose, an Episcopal priest and an aunt of the bride, took part.
The bride, 35, works in West Point, Pa., as an editor of promotional materials for the marketing communications department of Merck, the pharmaceuticals firm. She graduated from Davidson College.

Margaret Barclay Cunningham and Dr. Joseph Anthony Whitten were married last evening at the Episcopal Church of St. Michael and St. George in St. Louis. The Rev. Andrew Archie, rector of the church, performed the ceremony in which the Rev. Margaret R. Rose, an Episcopal priest and an aunt of the bride, took part.

Margaret Barclay Cunningham and Dr. Joseph Anthony Whitten were married last evening at the Episcopal Church of St. Michael and St. George in St. Louis. The Rev. Andrew Archie, rector of the church, performed the ceremony in which the Rev. Margaret R. Rose, an Episcopal priest and an aunt of the bride, took part.
The bride, 35, works in West Point, Pa., as an editor of promotional materials for the marketing communications department of Merck, the pharmaceuticals firm. She graduated from Davidson College.

She is the daughter of Charles Baker Cunningham of St. Louis and the late Georganne Rose Cunningham. Her father retired as the president and chief executive of Belden CDT, a St. Louis manufacturer of signal transmission products mainly for the entertainment, residential, industrial and security markets. Her mother was an adjunct assistant professor at the University of Missouri-St. Louis, where she taught educational psychology. She also had a private educational consulting practice serving children with special needs in St. Louis. The bride is a descendant of Pierre Laclède, a founder of St. Louis.

The bridegroom, 36, is a resident in family medicine at Abington Memorial Hospital in Abington, Pa. He graduated from Oberlin College and received a master's degree in biomedical sciences from Barry University in Miami Shores, Fla., and a medical degree from Temple University.

He is the son of Carol Pendás Whitten and Jamie Lloyd Whitten of Chevy Chase, Md. His mother retired as a senior adviser on Hispanic issues to the commissioner of the Head Start Bureau. From 1991 to 1992 she was a commissioner on the White House Commission on Educational Excellence for Hispanic Americans. His father is a partner in Whitten & Diamond, a Washington law firm.
The bridegroom is the grandson of the late Jamie Whitten, the longest-serving member of the House of Representatives, having represented a district in northern Mississippi from 1941 to 1995.
